etymologies: late 19th century. From German Podophyllotoxin from podophyll- (in Podophyllin) + -o- + Toxin

definitions: A glucoside, C₂₂ H₂₂ O₈, derived from podophyllin, which is used for its antimitotic properties in preparations for the treatment of genital warts, and in the manufacture of some antineoplastic drugs.
